metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15425 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in Omnibox in Google Chrome prior to 63.0.3239.84 allowed a remote attacker to perform domain spoofing via IDN homographs in a crafted domain name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15425` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1').
